au.com.agic.apptesting.steps

Class KeyEventSetpDefinitions

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.com.agic.apptesting.steps.KeyEventSetpDefinitions

  • @Component
public class KeyEventSetpDefinitions
extends java.lang.Object
    Gherkin steps for simulating key presses and other key events. These steps have Atom snipptets that start with the prefix "disptach" and "press". See https://github.com/mcasperson/iridium-snippets for more details.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • pressCtrlAStep

        @When(value="^I press CTRL-A on the active element( ignoring errors)?$")
public void pressCtrlAStep(java.lang.String ignoreErrors)
        Press the CTRL-A keys to the active element. This step is known to have issues with the Firefox Marionette driver.
        Parameters:
        ignoreErrors - Add this text to ignore any exceptions. This is really only useful for debugging.

      • pressCmdAStep

        @When(value="^I press CMD-A on the active element( ignoring errors)?$")
public void pressCmdAStep(java.lang.String ignoreErrors)
        Press the CMD-A keys to the active element. This step is known to have issues with the Firefox Marionette driver.
        Parameters:

      • pressCmdOrCtrlAStep

        @When(value="^I select all the text in the active element( ignoring errors)?$")
public void pressCmdOrCtrlAStep(java.lang.String ignoreErrors)
        Press the CMD-A or CTRL-A keys to the active element depending on the client os. This step is known to have issues with the Firefox Marionette driver.
        Parameters:
        ignoreErrors - Add this text to ignore any exceptions. This is really only useful for debugging.

      • pressDeleteStep

        @When(value="^I press(?: the)? Delete(?: key)? on the active element(?: \"(\\d+)\" times)?( ignoring errors)?$")
public void pressDeleteStep(java.lang.Integer times,
                                                                                                                                             java.lang.String ignoreErrors)
        Press the delete key on the active element. This step is known to have issues with the Firefox Marionette driver.
        Parameters:
        times - The number of times to press the delete key
        ignoreErrors - Add this text to ignore any exceptions. This is really only useful for debugging.
